channel.title: Painting on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Painting on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: A New Coat of Paint
item.description: Last year, Anthony Dortch suffered a major personal setback—surviving a stroke at a young age. This health struggle threatened to stop Dortch, a Washington, D.C.-based artist, from following his muse, a muse that he’s followed for years with a long-term creative project that’s taken on many layers. Quite literally, in fact. See, Dortch’s art literally involves painting people to and making them, effectively, into comic book characters—each in different colors to represent different walks of life, with elements of his storytelling highlighting issues of race, gender and sexuality.
